hints: Hero is a Brahmin guy from a super strict and religious family.
He falls in love with a Christian girl who works as a photographer.
Her dream is to settle in the US and have a beach wedding.
To convince their parents, both of them lie — but not the same lie.
Their lies lead to confusion, comedy, and chaos in both families.

details.Trivia: This film grossed over $1 million in the U.S, making it Nani's 7th film to do so.

hints: Hero is an NRI who lives a peaceful life in San Francisco.
One day, his ex-girlfriend calls him with a shocking request.
She says her daughter has been kidnapped, but no one believes her.
He returns to India and starts investigating the missing girl.
The truth he finds connects the girl to his own life in a shocking way.

details.Trivia: This film was officially remade in multiple languages — most notably in Hindi as Baaghi 2.

hints: Hero is a broke delivery boy fed up with his daily struggles.
He decides to steal a little money from an old lady’s flat.
Inside the apartment, he finds a bag with a huge amount of cash.
But things go wrong when a murder and drug case trap him inside.
With the help of his two best friends, he tries to escape the mess.

details.Trivia: The production used an actual retired police constable as a body double for Banerjee’s scenes — to perfect the gait and mannerisms of a real cop.

hints: Hero is a lively guy in Australia who doesn’t believe in forever love.
He falls for a sweet girl who wants a relationship that lasts forever.
He hides his real thoughts just to keep her happy.
Slowly, his painful past love story begins to surface.
In the end, he must choose between his beliefs and her dreams.

details.Trivia: The film is the largest Indian budget film that was mostly shot in Australia.[16] Over two hundred and fifty people from Australia were a part of the cast and crew.
